p: Mice were divided into six groups to receive the following treatments by oral administration (p.o.): vehicle (0.5% Tween 80 in saline solution), the reference drug diclofenac or ketorolac (10 mg/kg, p.o.), the crude extract (hexane, ethyl acetate or methanol at 300 mg/kg, p.o.) or the neo-clerodane diterpene (0.1, 1 or 10 mg/kg, p.o.). Thirty minutes after the treatment, mice were independently subjected to the nociceptive agent to induce pain-like behaviour.
